intro: Ilex cassine subsp. myrtifolia, commonly known as the Florida holly, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, white flowers in the spring, which are followed by bright red berries in the fall. These berries are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
